info.title: REST API Reference
info.description:
Uploadcare features a simple yet powerful REST API to manage projects and files. REST API is the lowest level of access to Uploadcare and is implemented into every client.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

x-meta.title: REST API 0.6 Reference â€” Uploadcare
x-meta.description: Complete reference documentation for the Uploadcare REST API 0.6. Covers endpoints, requests, their params, and response examples.

tags.name: Other REST API Versions
tags.description: You can find the complete reference documentation for the REST API 0.5 [here](/api-refs/rest-api/v0.5/).

tags.name: Other APIs
tags.description: You can find the complete reference documentation for the Upload API [here](/api-refs/upload-api/).

get.description: Getting a paginated list of files.

parameters.name: removed
parameters.description: `true` to only include removed files in the response, `false` to include existing files. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: stored
parameters.description: `true` to only include files that were stored, `false` to include temporary ones. The default is unset: both stored and not stored files are returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A preferred amount of files in a list for a single response. Defaults to 100, while the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Specifies the way files are sorted in a returned list. `field_name` - ascending order, `-field_name` - descending order.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A starting point for filtering files. The value depends on your ordering parameter value.

dateTimeUploaded.description: If ordering=datetime_uploaded then a datetime MUST be used, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, where T is used as a separator.

size.description: If ordering=size then an integer file size MUST be used. File sizes SHOULD be set in bytes.:

parameters.name: add_fields
parameters.description: Add special fields to the file object, such as: rekognition_info.

datetime_removed.description: Date and time when a file was removed, if any.

datetime_stored.description: Date and time of the last store request, if any.

datetime_uploaded.description: Date and time when a file was uploaded.

sequence.default: Is image if sequence image(GIF for example).

datetime_original.description: Image date and time from EXIF.

is_ready.description: Is file is ready to be used after upload.

original_file_url.description: Publicly available file CDN URL. Available if a file is not deleted.

original_filename.description: Original file name taken from uploaded file.

url.description: API resource URL for a particular file.

variations.description: Dictionary of other files that has been created using this file as source. Used for video, document and etc. conversion.

source.description: File upload source. This field contains information about from where file was uploaded, for example: facebook, gdrive, gphotos, etc.

rekognition_info.description: Dictionary of file categories with it"s confidence.

total.description: A total number of objects of the queried type. For files, the queried type depends on the stored and removed query parameters.

put.description: Used to store multiple files in one go. Up to 100 files are supported per request. A JSON object holding your File list SHOULD be put into a request body.

items.description: List of files UUIDs to store.

200.description: OK. See `problems` and `result` fields in the response. In case file list provided in a request holds invalid UUIDs, they will be included in the problems structure. Invalid UUIDs can be incomplete, associated with files that no longer exist, etc.

problems.description: Dictionary of passed files UUIDs and problems associated with these UUIDs.

result.description: List of file objects that has been deleted.

post.description: POST requests are used to copy original files or their modified versions to default storage. Source files MAY either be stored or just uploaded and MUST NOT be deleted.

source.description: A CDN URL or just UUID of a file subjected to copy.

store.description: The parameter only applies to the Uploadcare storage and MUST be either true or false.

201.description: POST requests return a JSON dictionary containing the type and result fields. For the url type, the result is a URL with the s3 scheme. Your bucket name is put as a host, and an s3 object path follows.

datetime_removed.description: Date and time when a file was removed, if any.

datetime_stored.description: Date and time of the last store request, if any.

datetime_uploaded.description: Date and time when a file was uploaded.

sequence.default: Is image if sequence image(GIF for example).

datetime_original.description: Image date and time from EXIF.

is_ready.description: Is file is ready to be used after upload.

original_filename.description: Original file name taken from uploaded file.

variations.description: Dictionary of other files that has been created using this file as source. Used for video, document and etc. conversion.

source.description: File upload source. This field contains information about from where file was uploaded, for example: facebook, gdrive, gphotos, etc.

400.description: Possible errors for file copy endpoint.

enum: Bad `source` parameter. Use UUID or CDN URL.
Project has no storage with provided name.
Invalid pattern provided: Invalid character in a pattern.
Copying of large files is not supported at the moment.
Not allowed on your current plan.
detail.example: File is not ready yet.

enum: Invalid signature. Please check your secret key.
detail.example: Incorrect authentication credentials.

detail.default: Could not satisfy the request Accept header.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before next request.

detail.example: Request was throttled. Expected available in 10 second.

post.description: POST requests are used to copy original files or their modified versions to a custom storage. Source files MAY either be stored or just uploaded and MUST NOT be deleted.

source.description: A CDN URL or just UUID of a file subjected to copy.

target.description: Identifies a custom storage name related to your project. Implies you are copying a file to a specified custom storage. Keep in mind you can have multiple storages associated with a single S3 bucket.

make_public.description: MUST be either true or false. true to make copied files available via public links, false to reverse the behavior.

pattern.description: The parameter is used to specify file names Uploadcare passes to a custom storage. In case the parameter is omitted, we use pattern of your custom storage. Use any combination of allowed values.

200.description: Destination file with that name already exists. Check `pattern` parameter. This code is used only for remote copy.

schema.description: See `201` code for information about response.

201.description: POST requests return a JSON dictionary containing the type and result fields. For the url type, the result is a URL with the s3 scheme. Your bucket name is put as a host, and an s3 object path follows.

result.description: For the url type, the result is a URL with the s3 scheme. Your bucket name is put as a host, and an s3 object path follows.

400.description: Simple auth. on HTTP or file copy errors.

get.description: Get a paginated list of groups.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A preferred amount of groups in a list for a single response. Defaults to 100, while the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A starting point for filtering group lists. MUST be a datetime value with T used as a separator.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Specifies the way groups are sorted in a returned list by creation time. `datetime_created` for ascending order, `-datetime_created` for descending order.

datetime_created.description: Date and time when a group was created.

datetime_stored.description: Date and time when files in a group were stored.

files_count.description: Number of files in a group.

cdn_url.description: Public CDN URL for a group.

url.description: API resource URL for a group.

total.description: A total number of objects of the queried type. For files, the queried type depends on the stored and removed query parameters.

400.description: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.

detail.example: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.
detail.default: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.

detail.example: Could not satisfy the request Accept header.

detail.example: Request was throttled. Expected available in 10 second.

post.description: Create and subscribe to webhook. See [an example notification](https://uploadcare.com/docs/api_reference/rest/webhooks/#payload?utm_source=api-ref&utm_campaign=rest-webhooks#create) that is sent on the `file.uploaded` event.

target_url.description: A URL that is triggered by an event, for example, a file upload. A target URL MUST be unique for each `project` â€” `event type` combination.

event.description: An event you subscribe to. Presently, we only support the `file.uploaded` event.

is_active.description: Marks a subscription as either active or not, defaults to `true`, otherwise `false`.

target_url.description: Where webhook data will be posted.

post.description: Uploadcare allows converting documents to the following target formats: DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, ODT, ODS, RTF, TXT, PDF, JPG, PNG.

paths.description: An array of UUIDs of your source documents to convert together with the specified target format (see [documentation](https://uploadcare.com/docs/document_conversion/#convert-url-formatting)).

store.description: A flag indicating if we should store your outputs.

problems.description: Dictionary of problems related to your processing job, if any. Key is the `path` you requested.

result.description: Result for each requested path, in case of no errors for that path.

original_source.description: Source file identifier including a target format, if present.

uuid.description: A UUID of your converted document.

token.description: A conversion job token that can be used to get a job status.

400.description: Simple auth. on HTTP or document conversion permission errors.

oneOf.description: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.
Document conversion feature is not available for this project.

detail.default: â€œpathsâ€ parameter is required.

value.detail: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.
Document conversion feature is not available for this project.
â€œpathsâ€ parameter is required.

detail.default: Could not satisfy the request Accept header.

get.description: Once you get a conversion job result, you can acquire a conversion job status via token. Just put it in your request URL as `:token`.

status.description: Conversion job status, can have one of the following values: - `pending` â€”  a source file is being prepared for conversion. - `processing` â€”  conversion is in progress. - `finished` â€” the conversion is finished. - `failed` â€” we failed to convert the source, see `error` for details. - `canceled` â€” the conversion was canceled.

error.description: Holds a conversion error if we were unable to handle your file.

result.description: Repeats the contents of your processing output.

uuid.description: A UUID of a converted target file.

400.description: Simple auth. on HTTP or document conversion permission errors.

oneOf.description: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.
Document conversion feature is not available for this project.

value.detail: Simple authentication over HTTP is forbidden. Please, use HTTPS or signed requests instead.
Document conversion feature is not available for this project.

enum: Invalid signature. Please check your secret key.
detail.example: Incorrect authentication credentials.

404.description: Job with specified ID is not found.

detail.example: Not found.
detail.default: Not found.

406.description: Invalid version header `Accept` for this endpoint.

detail.example: Could not satisfy the request Accept header.
detail.default: Could not satisfy the request Accept header.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before next request.

detail.example: Request was throttled. Expected available in 10 second.

post.description: Uploadcare Video Processing optimizes your video content delivery. It is not just about using CDN nodes that suit your user locations, bandwidths, etc. You can adjust video quality, format, and size.

paths.description: An array of UUIDs of your video files to process together with a set of needed operations (see [documentation](https://uploadcare.com/docs/video_encoding/#process-operations)).

store.description: A flag indicating if we should store your outputs.

problems.description: Dictionary of problems related to your processing job, if any. Key is the `path` you requested.

result.description: Result for each requested path, in case of no errors for that path.

original_source.description: Input file identifier including operations, if present.

uuid.description: A UUID of your processed video file.

token.description: A processing job token that can be used to get a job status.

thumbnails_group_uuid.description: UUID of a file group with thumbnails for an output video, based on the `thumbs` operation parameters.

get.description: Once you get a processing job result, you can acquire a processing job status via token. Just put it in your request URL as `:token`.

status.description: Processing job status, can have one of the following values: - `pending` â€” video file is being prepared for conversion. - `processing` â€” video file processing is in progress. - `finished` â€” the processing is finished. - `failed` â€” we failed to process the video, see `error` for details. - `canceled` â€” video processing was canceled.

error.description: Holds a processing error if we failed to handle your video.

result.description: Repeats the contents of your processing output.

uuid.description: A UUID of your processed video file.

thumbnails_group_uuid.description: A UUID of a file group with thumbnails for an output video, based on the `thumbs` operation parameters.

apiKeyAuth.name: Authorization
apiKeyAuth.description:
Every request made to `https://api.uploadcare.com/` MUST be signed.

To authenticate, requests MUST contain the `Authorization` header defining `auth-scheme` and `auth-param`:

``` Authorization: auth-scheme auth-param ```

There are two available authorization schemes:
* `Uploadcare.Simple`, a simple scheme where your [Secret API Key](https://uploadcare.com/docs/account/?utm_source=api-ref&utm_campaign=rest-auth#keys-secret) MUST be specified in every request's `auth-param`. Learn more in our [docs](https://uploadcare.com/docs/api_reference/rest/requests_auth/?utm_source=api-ref&utm_campaign=rest-auth#auth-simple).
* `Uploadcare`, a more sophisticated scheme where a `signature`, not your Secret API Key MUST be specified. Signatures are then generated on your backend. Learn more in our [docs](https://uploadcare.com/docs/api_reference/rest/requests_auth/?utm_source=api-ref&utm_campaign=rest-auth#auth-uploadcare).

Every request SHOULD contain the `Accept` header identifying the REST API version:

``` Accept: application/vnd.uploadcare-v0.6+json ```

If the `Accept` header is not present, a default API version is used: [v0.5](/api-refs/rest-api/v0.5/).

Every request MUST contain the `Date` header and the date MUST NOT exceed the 15-minute offset from the server time of the API endpoint. Learn more in our [docs](https://uploadcare.com/docs/api_reference/rest/requests_auth/?utm_source=api-ref&utm_campaign=rest-auth#auth-uploadcare)
